column4: E: Malformed line 55 in source list /etc/apt/sources.list (dist)
where's the file I need to look at in a text editor?
okay, I found the source list - it appears line 55 (and 54) are from attempts to install libreoffice, it reads : deb http://download.tuxfamily.com/gericom/libreoffice/
can I just delete lines 54 and 55?
they're both "deb http://download.tuxfamily.com/gericom/libreoffice/" , from unsuccessful attempts to install libreoffice
okay, that let me run autoremove, but I'm still having a problem with my trash being 'full' whenever I want to delete anything.  I'm using KDEbuntu though, do you think it's a dolphin problem?
don't run a tool, just remove those linues
I did remove those lines.  I got the original error message from trying to run the autoremove command
remove the lines, then do "sudo apt-get update"
